channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Road wearing, 16th January
item.description:
Road is wearing away causing cars hitting raised area accessing end of the road (car park /footpath ) Kind of hard to explain (guess like road to curb ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 123a Broad Oak Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large pothole, 16th January
item.description:
Pothole at least 50cm across and very deep. Can't avoid if oncoming traffic. On kerbside edge so dangerous for cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Willersey Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defaced parking signs Margrett Road, Cheltenham, 16th January
item.description:
Multiple parking restriction signs in Margrett Road have been defaced with black paint obscuring the information about parking restrictions. The signs are outside no.s 2 (by junction with St Paul’s Road), 6, 14 and 18 Margrett Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Margrett Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Long term unrepaired pothole contributing to carriageway breakdown.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 46 Yarnolds, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another Flytip at the Location, 16th January
item.description:
A small flytip - not yet collected) was reported at this location and has been added to quite significantly. The location is on the Whittington Road just past the Burnt Oak Crossroads on the left hand side. The tip consistsa of mattress, bed, boards, childs car seat and general rubbish. There are some documents there as well. Please can it be collected as soon as possible so as to prevent further tips being added to it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road surface causing excessive shaking of nearby housing, 15th January
item.description:
Since the late 2022 cold spell the A40 road surface has become very uneven. In additio to the many potholes, there is also a shallow but wide area where the top road surface is missing. The noise polution from larger vehicles travelling on this stretch of road has increased and the vibrations are now enough to shake people awake in nearby housing and cause concern for the stability of the buildings. Please make the road surface smooth.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 21 Campden Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 15th January
item.description:
This road is a disgrace and the same holes have been filled several times over. There are two ways of doing any job and we know how the contractor is doing these, probably taking a leaf out of the book of whoever did the nearby A40 which is also a disgrace. They must be laughing all the way to the bank knowing they'll have to come back, shove another dollop of blacktop into very familiar Benhall holes and submit yet more cash-cow invoices to GCC.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Willersey Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes and gravel patches, 15th January
item.description:
There is a series of potholes and gravel patches along the yellow line areas pushing cyclists out into the traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 115 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Twisted steel dumped in hedge, 15th January
item.description:
There is a big pile of twisted rusty steel dumped in the undergrowth between Oldfield Crescent and the A40 at the Griffith's Avenue junction as indicated by the location. I suspect this is steel armour from old fashioned electrical cable, related to the works to remodel the Griffith's Avenue junction for the new cycle path. Please could you remove this?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1a Oldfield Crescent, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots corner of Bedford and Cornwall, 15th January
item.description:
The tree roots of broken through the tarmac and present a hazard for wheelchair or ability scooter users. At the same time, you could also patch up the tree roots on the same side for the large tree near the junction of Allstone and Bedford.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 61 Brooklyn Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
